Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use collective nouns (e.g., group).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Form and use frequently occurring irregular plural nouns (e.g., feet, children, teeth, mice, fish).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use reflexive pronouns (e.g., myself, ourselves).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Form and use the past tense of frequently occurring irregular verbs (e.g., sat, hid, told).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use adjectives and adverbs, and choose between them depending on what is to be modified.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Produce, expand, and rearrange complete simple and compound sentences (e.g., The boy watched the movie; The little boy watched the movie; The action movie was watched by the little boy).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Capitalize holidays, product names, and geographic names.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use commas in greetings and closings of letters.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use an apostrophe to form contractions and frequently occurring possessives.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Generalize learned spelling patterns when writing words (e.g., cage ? badge; boy ? boil).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Consult reference materials, including beginning dictionaries, as needed to check and correct spellings

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Compare formal and informal uses of English.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 2 reading and content, choosing flexibly from an array of strategies.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use sentence-level context as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Determine the meaning of the new word formed when a known prefix is added to a known word (e.g., happy/unhappy, tell/retell).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use a known root word as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word with the same root (e.g., addition, additional).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use knowledge of the meaning of individual words to predict the meaning of compound words (e.g., birdhouse, lighthouse, housefly; bookshelf, notebook, bookmark).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use glossaries and beginning dictionaries, both print and digital, to determine or clarify the meaning of words and phrases.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Demonstrate understanding of word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., describe foods that are spicy or juicy).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Distinguish shades of meaning among closely related verbs (e.g., toss, throw, hurl) and closely related adjectives (e.g., thin, slender, skinny, scrawny).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading and being read to, and responding to texts, including using adjectives and adverbs to describe (e.g., When other kids are happy that makes me happy).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Distinguish long and short vowels when reading regularly spelled one-syllable words.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Know spelling-sound correspondences for additional common vowel teams.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Decode regularly spelled two-syllable words with long vowels.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Decode words with common prefixes and suffixes.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Identify words with inconsistent but common spelling-sound correspondences.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Recognize and read grade-appropriate irregularly spelled words.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Read grade-level text with purpose and understanding.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Read grade-level text orally with accuracy, appropriate rate, and expression.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, rereading as necessary.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Ask and answer such questions as who, what, where, when, why, and how to demonstrate understanding of key details in a text.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Identify the main topic of a multiparagraph text as well as the focus of specific paragraphs within the text.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Describe the connection between a series of historical events, scientific ideas or concepts, or steps in technical procedures in a text.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases in a text relevant to a grade 2 topic or subject area.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Know and use various text features (e.g., captions, bold print, subheadings, glossaries, indexes, electronic menus, icons) to locate key facts or information in a text efficiently.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Identify the main purpose of a text, including what the author wants to answer, explain, or describe.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Explain how specific images (e.g., a diagram showing how a machine works) contribute to and clarify a text.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Describe how reasons support specific points the author makes in a text.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Compare and contrast the most important points presented by two texts on the same topic.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Subcategory: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity
Description: By the end of year, read and comprehend informational texts, including history/social studies, science, and technical texts, in the grades 2â€“3 text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Ask and answer such questions as who, what, where, when, why, and how to demonstrate understanding of key details in a text.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Recount stories, including fables and folktales from diverse cultures, and determine their central message, lesson, or moral.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Describe how characters in a story respond to major events and challenges.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Describe how words and phrases (e.g., regular beats, alliteration, rhymes, repeated lines) supply rhythm and meaning in a story, poem, or song.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Describe the overall structure of a story, including describing how the beginning introduces the story and the ending concludes the action.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Acknowledge differences in the points of view of characters, including by speaking in a different voice for each character when reading dialogue aloud.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use information gained from the illustrations and words in a print or digital text to demonstrate understanding of its characters, setting, or plot.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Compare and contrast two or more versions of the same story (e.g., Cinderella stories) by different authors or from different cultures.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Subcategory: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity
Description: By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including prose and poetry, in the grades 2â€“3 text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about grade 2 topics and texts with peers and adults in small and larger groups.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., gaining the floor in respectful ways, listening to others with care, speaking one at a time about the topics and texts under discussion).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Build on othersâ€™ talk in conversations by linking their comments to the remarks of others.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Ask for clarification and further explanation as needed about the topics and texts under discussion.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Recount or describe key ideas or details from a text read aloud or information presented orally or through other media.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Ask and answer questions about what a speaker says in order to clarify comprehension, gather additional information, or deepen understanding of a topic or issue.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Tell a story or recount an experience with appropriate facts and relevant, descriptive details, speaking audibly in coherent sentences.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Create audio recordings of stories or poems; add drawings or other visual displays to stories or recounts of experiences when appropriate to clarify ideas, thoughts, and feelings.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Produce complete sentences when appropriate to task and situation in order to provide requested detail or clarification. (See grade 2 Language standards 1and 3 on page 26 for specific expectations.)

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Write opinion pieces in which they introduce the topic or book they are writing about, state an opinion, supply reasons that support the opinion, use linking words (e.g., because, and, also) to connect opinion and reasons, and provide a concluding statement or section.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Write informative/explanatory texts in which they introduce a topic, use facts and definitions to develop points, and provide a concluding statement or section.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Write narratives in which they recount a well-elaborated event or short sequence of events, include details to describe actions, thoughts, and feelings, use temporal words to signal event order, and provide a sense of closure.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: With guidance and support from adults and peers, focus on a topic and strengthen writing as needed by revising and editing.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: With guidance and support from adults, use a variety of digital tools to produce and publish writing, including in collaboration with peers.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Subcategory: Research to Build and Present Knowledge
Description: Participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., read a number of books on a single topic to produce a report; record science observations).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Subcategory: Research to Build and Present Knowledge
Description: Recall information from experiences or gather information from provided sources to answer a question.
